document.docAuthor: Palacio, Edgard, Bordera, Santiago & Díaz, Francisco
document.docTitle: Clistopyga teresitae Palacio & Bordera & Díaz 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae) Part III: the C. henryi species group, with the description of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae) Part III: the C. henryi species group, with the description of three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Clistopyga teresitae
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other Neotropical species of the
C. henryi
species group by the combination of the following characters: ovipositor straight ( Fig. 6D ); submetapleural carina incomplete, only present at anterior 0.3–0.5 ( Fig. 7D ); hind wing with distal abscissa of Cu 1 well pigmented ( Fig. 9B ); metapleuron and propodeum laterally white ( Fig. 6B ); tergites II to VIII predominantly red to reddish brown ( Figs 6C, F ).
Description. Female: Body length 9.6–13.3 mm . Fore wing length 7.0– 10.8 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Clistopyga
spp., tergite I, ♀. A.
C. carinata Bordera & Palacio
sp. nov.
, holotype. B–C.
C. declinata Palacio & Bordera
sp. nov.
, holotype and paratype, respectively. D.
C. henryi Gauld
, paratype. E–F.
C. teresitae Díaz, Palacio & Bordera
sp. nov.
, paratype and holotype, respectively. Scale bar: 0.3 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Wings . Fore wing with vein cu-a opposite Rs & M . Vein 2 rs-m 0.5–0.6× as long as abscissa of M between 2 rsm and 2 m-cu . Abscissa of Cu 1 between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a 1.4–1.5× as long as Cu 1 b . Hind wing with vein cu-a 0.50– 0.60× as long as abscissa of Cu 1 between M and cu-a ; vein cu-a reclivous, abscissa of Cu 1 vertical and straight; distal abscissa of Cu 1 well pigmented ( Fig. 9B ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Clistopyga
spp., ♀. A–B. Hind wing: A.
C. henryi Gauld
, paratype, B .
C. teresitae Díaz, Palacio & Bordera
sp. nov.
, holotype (arrows indicate the distal abscissa of Cu 1). C–D. Fore leg tibia: C.
C. carinata Bordera & Palacio
sp. nov.
, holotype, D.
C. teresitae Díaz, Palacio & Bordera
sp. nov.
, paratype (arrows indicate the swelling at basal half of fore tibia). Scale bar: 0.3 mm.

FIGURE 10.
C.
henryi
Gauld
, habitus, lateral view, paratype, ♂.

FIGURE 11.
C.
henryi
Gauld
, paratype, ♂. A. Head, frontal view. B. Head and mesosoma, lateral view. C. Wings and metasoma, lateral view. D. Head and mesosoma, dorsal view. E. Metasoma, dorsal view. Scale bar: 0.3 mm (A, D, B); 0.5 mm (C, E).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology: This species is named in honor of Joscelin Teresita Díaz, daughter of Francisco Díaz, coauthor of this paper.
